Digital Representation: Finite and Infinite Information


Information is the basis in which a computer operates. when we talk about digital conversion, the word itself implies a transformation of an event that occurs in the real world into "digits" or units.
In this chapter we analize the process in which real events are transformed into information to be operated by a computer and the implications of digitalization.


Let's start by working with an example to better show how it is that computers are used to model the world. Music is in this sense a perfect example, mainly because it is something we all have experience with and much of the internet and therefore computer usage is geared towards music listening or creation.  

As a physical phenomena, music can be seen as the conscious manipulation of sound waves. Sound is a transference of energy through a medium, normally air, in a range that our sensors (auditory system) can perceive. This distinction is important because x-rays are also waves of energy that we are not equiped to sense, and we don't call x-ray's sound, only what our ears can catch.
